inclusion.criterion: Condition requiring chronic transurethral catheterization for at least 1 month prior to enrollment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Indwelling transurethral catheter not scheduled for exchange for at least 1 week from first treatment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Documented asymptomatic bacteriuria as defined in the protocol
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Vital signs within the following limits: blood pressure 90 to 160 mm Hg systolic and 50 to100 mm Hg diastolic, pulse rate 45 to 100 bpm, respiratory rate 8 to 24 respirations per minute, oral body temperature 35.5ºC to 38.0ºC
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Screening must occur within 14 days of enrollment into the study
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: History of hepatitis B or C, HIV, AIDS, or other immunodeficiency disease
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Systemic antibiotics within 7 days of enrollment
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any condition that, in the opinion of the principal investigator, would make the subject unsuitable for the study or place the subject at additional risk.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Any investigational drug or investigational device within 30 days of enrollment in the study
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Women who are pregnant or lactating; or of child-bearing potential unless using highly effective birth control method for 1 month prior to and during the study
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has a history of CVA, neurogenic bladder with indwelling suprapubic catheter, and recurrent UTIs. They are currently being treated for urosepsis and have a non-obstructing stone in the L ureter.
